titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 417) to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to reform the financing of campaigns for elections for Federal office, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-311, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 417 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment shall be in order except those printed in H. Rept. 106-311. All points of order against the amendments printed in the report are waived except that the adoption of an amendment in the nature of a substitute shall constitute the conclusion of consideration of the bill for amendment.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 106.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 283.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/8/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 417 (campaign financing).
